resources.string: Named after the Dominican Albertus Magnus, the building houses the College of Education, the Conservatory of Music, and the Education High School.

Home to Some 500 Plant Species", The UST Botanical Gardens has one of the largest number of herbal plants in the city. Its range of plants includes several of the Filipino variety as well those of the fire and zinnia trees. It is an absolute delight to be walking among the plants and listen to the endless chirping of all kinds of birds and insects. For nature lovers, this is a must-see.

This building houses the UST Chapel (which is also the Santisimo Rosario Parish Church) the UST Central Seminary, and the UST Ecclesiastical Faculties. The Parish was canonically inaugurated on April 26, 1942 by Michael O\'Doherty, the Archbishop of Manila during that time.

The Arch of the Centuries is a triumphal arch at the Plaza Intramuros of the University of Santo Tomas in Manila, in the Philippines that stands meters away from the university\'s Millennium Gate along Espa√±a Boulevard.
The UST Miguel de Benavides Library, is the central library of the University of Santo Tomas. The Library has been in continuous service and even antedates the existence of the University itself.

Considered as a 21st Century park because of its contemporary landscape elements found in the park. The plan is almost symmetrical. The color scheme is so marvelous it gives of a historical element to the site. that it Its design is linear for easy access of the students passing between the Main Building and the Library.
